snippet: The rising market in the first quarter was built on technology and consumer stocks, not the safe, income-producing shares that led it higher at the start of 2011.
abstract: Paul J Lim Fundamentally column suggests that the strong first quarter for equity mutual funds is reminiscent of their hot start in early 2011, just before the market ran headlong into a major pullback in the spring and the summer; cautions that the rising market has been built on less safe technology and consumer stocks, signaling that investors are still wary about the strength of the economic recovery.
lead_paragraph: The rising market in the first quarter was built on technology and consumer stocks, not the safe, income-producing shares that led it higher at the start of 2011.

headline.seo: Classic Growth Stocks Are Leading This Market Rally
headline.main: Another Rally, but a New Cast of Characters
headline.print_headline: Another Rally, but a New Cast of Characters
